sentences.english: His daughter, Emily, 16 is a junior in high school.
sentences.chinese: 他的女兒艾米麗芳齡16歲，是一名中學生。

sentences.english: One day is carousing in ward, this lets one fragrant age beautiful nurse sees.
sentences.chinese: 一日正在病房痛飲，這讓一芳齡美麗的護士看到。

sentences.english: A simple maiden in her flower is worth a hundred coats of arms.
sentences.chinese: 正值芳齡的純潔少女值一百枚勳章。

definition: one's age, according to the traditional Chinese method of reckoning (i.e. the number of Chinese calendar years in which one has lived). In this system, a person's age is one year at birth, and increases by one year at the beginning of the first solar term 立春[Li4 chun1] each year, rather than on one's birthday./as opposed to 足歲|足岁[zu2 sui4]/see also 實歲|实岁[shi2 sui4]
(of a girl) in the prime of youth
to throw oneself in sb's arms/to throw oneself at sb
lit. hiding the moon, shaming the flowers (idiom)/fig. female beauty exceeding even that of the natural world
to scratch one's foot/(fig.) to be stingy/(slang) (of a celebrity) to twiddle one's thumbs (i.e. not release any new material etc)
start explaining and it's a long story (idiom); complicated and not easy to express succinctly
lit. capable of causing the downfall of a city or state (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) devastatingly beautiful/also written 傾城傾國|倾城倾国[qing1 cheng2 qing1 guo2]
overwhelmed by favor from superior (humble expr.)
(of a slave or servant) to be given one's freedom/(of a prostitute) to marry and leave one's trade
to deserve praise for one's courage (idiom)
